intro: Laelia pumila var. dayana, commonly known as the Dayana miniature orchid, is a small, terrestrial orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, linear leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, typically blooming in the spring. It prefers cool, humid environments and well-draining soil, making it suitable for greenhouse cultivation. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a challenging but rewarding plant for experienced orchid growers.
